description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft Speech Application Programming Interface (SAPI) remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-43574):

1. Identify and verify the version of Windows you are running.
2. Download and apply the appropriate update package(s) using the links below:
   - [Windows 11 Version 24H2](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)
   - [Windows 11 Version 23H2](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - [Windows 11 Version 22H2](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)
   - [Windows 11 Version 21H2](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280)
   - [Windows 10 Version 22H2](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)
   - [Windows 10 Version 21H2](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)

**Details**:
This fix addresses a vulnerability where an attacker could exploit a use after free flaw, potentially allowing remote code execution. Applying the updates corresponds to various Windows builds outlined below.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is compatible with the listed update packages.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the installation of the updates.
